CatDescriptText: Ben Careathers, retired businessman, Beltzhoover, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 3, 1960, pg. A1 with question "What is our country's most pressing domestic problem?"  Answer reads: "The three most pressing domestic problems concern the economic situation, civil rights, and care for the aged...As for jobs, there are millions of unemployed because there are not enough jobs...In the field of civil rights, there are many arguments, both in the North and in the South, over what is to be done.  And as yet, the Supreme Court 1954 decision has not been effectuated.  The other problem concerns the aged...There are many persons who are elderly and are unable to pay their medical expenses.  The meagre bill, recently passed by Congress, solves nothing..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait in profile of Ben Careathers wearing eyeglasses and light colored shirt, seated in light colored car; Portrait of Ben Careathers wearing eyeglasses and light colored shirt, seated in light colored car with arm resting on door
